the problem is, ive just installed ubuntu on one of my pc's located on a LAN (other pcs are win xp based). the installation went well, however i cant seem to print on a printer attached to one of the other pcs. can anyone help?
is the printer shared using windows file/network sharing or a networked printer?
its just using windows file/network/printer sharing
ok.  Go to system -> administration -> printing, then 'new printer'
Then select 'network printer' and change the option box from CUPS to Windows Printer (smb)
Hopefully the samba shares on the network will appear and you can find your printer and connect to it.  And hope there's a driver for it, because linux printer support is not total.

It might help if you went over to the XP system and watched the print monitor as you tried to print, that'll show you if your computer is seeing the share and sending data

I'm out of ideas, then.  I have gotten samba printing working in ubuntu, so it's not broken.
Your printer has 4 different drivers available in the printer dialogs, maybe you should try another?

after you select your printer from the list, you can choose a different driver for that specific printer from the dialog box under the list.  It's certainly worth trying to others to see if one of them works.
